results.title: At the beach
results.brief_description: Scenes at Australian metropolitan beaches of crowds of people sunbathing, skylarking, swimming, and surfing. Without spoken commentary.

results.title: As long as I can walk
results.brief_description: A report on a Moratorium March held in Melbourne in 1970. Interviews with marchers give insights into personal motives, and show the strong desire for a peaceful settlement of the Vietnam question.
results.description: A report on a Moratorium March held in Melbourne in 1970. Interviews with marchers give insights into personal motives, and show the strong desire for a peaceful settlement of the Vietnam question.

results.title: Architecture: a performing art
results.creator_credit: Film Australia and Michael Robertson Film Productions
results.brief_description: An overview of the career and lifestyle of the Australian architect, John Andrews whose better known accomplishments include the CTT Tower in Toronto - the tallest free-standing structure in the world, the International Shipping Terminal at Miami, the Cameron Offices in Canberra and the American Express Tower in Sydney.

results.title: The Apprentice
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Alan Harkness and Fontana Films
results.brief_description: Answers the questions of potential apprentices and their parents about how the apprenticeship scheme works in Australian industry by concentrating on Robert, an apprentice fitter and turner with an automotive firm. Robert, his father and his supervisor give their views on the training involved, which is intended to develop a boy’s character as well as to produce a good craftsman.

results.title: Anzac: a nation's heritage
results.creator_credit: Lee Robinson, Denys Brown, Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A commemoration of the 50th anniversary of the landing by Australian and New Zealand troops on the Gallipoli Peninsula. Highlights include memorial services in Australia, New Zealand and Britain, a re-enactment at Anzac cove and scenes of Gallipoli and Troy today.

results.title: Another sunny day in Western Australia
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows outdoor activities occurring on a typical sunny day in Perth, Western Australia. The emphasis is on sporting activities; bowling, athletics, sailing, surfing, cycling and trampolining.

results.title: Alpine Playground
results.creator_credit: Tourist Development Authority of Victoria and Cinesound
results.brief_description: A holiday with a difference; the joys of an alpine winter holiday in Victoria’s picturesque skiing resorts, Mt Buffalo, Mt Hotham and Falls Creek. Within easy reach of Melbourne, facilities include expert ski instruction, readily available ski tows, toboggans, and comfortable accommodation.

results.title: All rounder
results.brief_description: This interesting vignette from the Movietone News programs compares a motor vehicle driver to an all-round cricketer. Most cricketers specialise in one aspect of the game, but an all-rounder can prove a most valuable asset to a team, as Richie Benaud did for the Australian team in the test series. Drivers, too need all-round skills; reckless driving and a lack of concentration are fatal on both the oval and the road! No other credits available.

results.title: All manner of trains
results.brief_description: The capacity, scope, problems and future of Australia’s six State and one Commonwealth railway systems. We accompany a railway worker from Cairns to Perth, by rail, and then visit workshops to see carriages and locomotives being made, and modern methods of mechanised track laying. Specially designed rolling stock is used for stock transport, bulk wheat and sugar moving, transporting cars and semi-trailers, and for moving timber. No other credits available.
